page.title: 11EPPING'S COMMUNITY HOSPITAL
page.content: {St.Margaret's Hospital}in Epping started as a{workhouse}and parts of it are a Victorian monument to sadness and misery.It changed into a major {casualty hospital}in the Second World War.Many of Epping's inhabitants were born there,and old people of Epping die in Forest Wing. The most recent change is taking place now. Princess Alexandra Hospital, Harlow, is now to be the major hospital. St Margaret's is to be a centre for the{mentally handicapped and{the elderly.}Also included in future plans are an audiology unit and a hearing aid centre due to come into operation in September 1985. Geriatric units are to remain as they are. Three out of the four units at present are for female elderly, with 54 female and 14 male patients. (cont.)
